description: The round payoff this round was 80. You, John chose to play option 1.Kate chose to play option 2. You received a payoff of 0.

The game resembles a coordination problem with multiple equilibria, where mutual cooperation (both choosing option 1) yields higher payoffs than mutual defection (both choosing option 2), but unilateral defection (one choosing 2 while the other chooses 1) risks a severe penalty for the cooperator.

The outcome highlights the importance of trust and predictability in repeated interactions. If players cannot reliably coordinate on mutual cooperation, they risk suboptimal payoffs, as seen when John chose 1 and Kate chose 2, resulting in John receiving 0.
